alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville; Mecklenburg; Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:14PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Isolated strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, Greensville, southeastern Mecklenburg, west central Southampton, southwestern Sussex and Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 1015 PM EST... At 913 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers and isolated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brodnax to near Kittrell. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts to 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lawrenceville around 925 PM EST. Radium around 940 PM EST. Purdy around 945 PM EST. Emporia around 950 PM EST. Jarratt around 955 PM EST. Sussex around 1015 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Adams Grove, Grizzard, Gum Forks, Bufford Crossroads, Lanes Corner, Booker, Dolphin, Bowens Corner, Yale and Pleasant Shade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
